quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Kahlua Sombrero, please.

quotes.speaker: Waiter
quotes.line: All right, so just you tonight?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Actually, I am meeting somebody, but I'm a little bit early. Leaving my company. After 19 years.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: I'll drink to that. I'm starting at a company this week.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, really?

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: To begginings and endings.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And to middles, the unsung heroes. And to moms.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: The moms and the troops.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Do not tell my fiance I'm drinking on a Wednesday.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: [laughs] I won't... I don't know her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm moving out to the burbs... actually, I'm moving further than the burbs, I'm moving to Colorado.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Colorado! The sunshine state.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yep. Don't mess with Colorado.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Doing some skiing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no. I don't want to end up like Sunny Bobo.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Well that's just good sense right there. Everyone I know who skis is dead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You know, I would like to try the luge, through.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Try it once, you're hooked. That's my guess.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's what I've heard.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: I'm an olympics nut.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh yeah? Me too. Summer or winter?

quotes.speaker: Deangelo/Michael
quotes.line: [in unison] Summer!

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: [holds out fist] Knuckles! Actually, I gotta come around and give you...

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: You know, it's funny, I tried to get an animal olympics going.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Really? What happened?

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: You know, life happened. What are you gonna miss most about Scranton?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh... wow. The mountains. Where things are.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: That's the way it goes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Man, he is late. I'm gonna call him. Do you mind? I'm sorry. [calls Deangelo, Deangelo's phone vibrates]

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Excuse me. Hello? You running late?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, I'm here. I'm right... I'm at the bar.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: I'm at the bar too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You are? What bar?

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: I'm at the bar. The bar that's located in the lobby of the hotel.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I... do not see you.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: How long have you...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm been here about... gosh, over half an hour.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Ok, me too.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo/Michael
quotes.line: [looking up from phones in unison] Sorry...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What're you wearing?

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: I am wearing a grey suit, red tie.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Are we both at the right place?

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Which place?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I hear your voice.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: I hear your voice, I see your lips moving.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I see your voice in the phone. Oh, man! [holds out hand] Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Deangelo Vickers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Wow... that is insane! [laughter]

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: That is insane, that is the right term. Let's get some Vodka up in this cranberry, and one for my friend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [entering Dunder Mifflin offices] Here we go! Are you ready?

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: I am ready.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Alright! Here we go!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: This is it. What do you think?

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Oh, she'll do. She'll do just fine.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: I am very much looking forward to tommorow. It feels like the culmanation of a lot of hard work, a lot of good fortune...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [pops up from below camera, and runs out of room]

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Did that? Did that just happen?! [runs after Michael] We should.. we should write a movie or something! I'm serious!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Michael is leaving. And apparently they've already hired a new manager. And we're meeting him today. It's a lot to process. Paperwork wise.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [wearing wig] Nope! It's not Ashton Kutcher. It's Kevin Malone! Equally handsome, equally smart! [winks]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok, everyone, as you know, one of my favorite things is fanfare for it's own sake. So, without further ado, let's start clapping! Presenting Deangelo Vickers!

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: [blinds roll down, Deangelo waving]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Come on out!

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Hello! [opens door] How are you sir?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I am well, sir, how are you?

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Can I just say, I am so excited to be working here. Little bit about myself, I love the American Southwest, for starters. You may call them Arizona, New Mexico, Nevada, Utah, I call them heaven. I have a peanut allergy, something I live with, it's a part of me. I've learned to cope with it. What else, I'm just as comfortable at the ball game as I am at the opera. I was a-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Did I want to be made manager? Sure. A great opportunity squandered? Absolutely. A crushing blow? Yes. Will I get over it? No. But life goes on. Not for me.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [drops papers as Deangelo walks by] I'll get that you guys. Don't... it's just... you know...

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: [picks up paper] I'll help you.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Oh, hi! [obviously flirting body language]

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Hello!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Have we met before?

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: No, not officially, actually, I saw you walking out of the bathroom before.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Well, I guess I'll go back to my cave. It was really great meeting you.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: [offers Kelly the papers as she walks away]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: And that is what you call a meet cute.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And we talk for like 20 minutes, no clue it's Deangelo the whole time!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Kind of embarassing.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Yeah, that story makes you sound stupid.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I happen to like the hilarious hijinx I get myself into. There he is! Deangelo, I was just telling them about last night, when we met. Remember that? That was crazy!

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Oh. [chuckles] That was... let's see, where's my replacement? Where's the guy I'm replacing? Why don't I look to the left? He's sitting right there! [office laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh yeah... I know... that's what I was just saying... that's what...

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: [silences Michael]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: That exact situation is why I always carry around some of these. [holds up 'Hello, my name is..,'] nametags. Just in case. Because sometimes you just need to I.D. yourself.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: [laughs] Office funny guy! Always glad to have an office funny guy around!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I wasn't even trying to make a joke. But I guess I've always been sorta quirky, offbeat, a little twisted.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: This is Jim and Pam, aka Jap. What started as an affair has blossomed into a family before our eyes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well, it wasn't an affair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes it was.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: But, no, but we are a family.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [points to picture of Cecelia] We made that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Cecelia.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Well, congratulations. I have four kids of my own.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Really? Oh, my gosh! We just have the one, but she poops for four. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Uh oh. Someone started off on the right foot with the new boss!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah, they don't ever talk about careers that were made because of unplanned pregnancies.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Thanks for meeting me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Are you kidding? I'd come anywhere to see a turtle? Where'd you find him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: There's no turtle, Michael. I just wanted to get you here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You know me very well, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That's because I'm your right-hand man, Michael, but I can't do it again. I can't do it again for a whole new guy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Now I'm gonna have to go online and look at turtles or I'll be off all day.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I want to be manager. I just don't understand why I wasn't even interviewed for the job. What's wrong? I was totally qualified, you were pushing for me.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: That apple looks delic!

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: I do a lot of portion control. I try to keep my daily calor intake under 1200. [laughter]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Deangelo, you're going to starve to death. [laughter]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: So you decided to have an orgy and not invite me? I call the middle!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: It's cool that you like the southwest. It's one of my favorite regions.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: It's one of my favorite regions? Did I just sound totally lame? No, I sounded good.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: I love the desert. It's one of my favorite ecosystems.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Here's the great thing about the southwest; there's so much more than desert. Along the north rim of the Grand Canyon is a forest as lush as you've ever seen.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Burnt! It's lush, dummie. Hey, Deangelo, what do you think of bald people? I hate them.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Deangelo, I forget, did you mention you like politics?

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: I did not.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Cause I was thinking that you should meet my boyfriend, he's a state senator. I really think the two of you would hit it off. He's a great person to know.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Sounds very interesting, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Dunder Mifflin, this is Erin. Ok, let me transfer you.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Why do you use your name when you use the phone?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Oh, that's how Pam does it. I just copy her. She's sort of a living legend.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Try it without using your name.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Dunder Mifflin, this is... oh, I like it!

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Dunder Mifflin, how may I assist you?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Oh, assist.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I sorta like the old way.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: I just prefer it without the name and I thought- I've got to start doing some managing at some point.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know, I know, I'm sorry, but if it's not a big deal we should just-

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: And it really isn't.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Is that good?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Yeah, ok, good.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Well, I'd like to change it, actually.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, whatever. Whatever you think will work.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: What do you think?

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: I think a change would be nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You can do the old way or whatever you think would work. [phone rings]

quotes.speaker: Denagelo
quotes.line: [whispering] Change it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: [picks up phone] ...I'm so sorry. Sorry. [hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Hey, funny guy. Wanna have a little mid-day lawl here. Make me laugh, huh? What you got? I can't even look at you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Here we go... ok... what do African Americans call... [laughter]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Deangelo, did you order a barber?

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Oh, yeah. Put a pin on that, kid. Can't wait to hear the punchline.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Finish the joke, Andy. What do African Americans call?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I... don't know. Help me.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: [a barber enters the office for Deangelo] That is so badass. So hardcore.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Yeah, real cool. Real power move.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: I saw a hawk today. Just sitting right there on the overpass. Looking at me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [to Erin] Shave me. [walks into office with Deangelo] This is going to be funny! Looks like we are going to be shaving buddies!

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Ok, alright! I love it! I love it! Michael, this is Reggie. He is the #1 yelp reviewed shaver in Scranton. It's not even close.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And this is Erin and she is going to shave my face. Here we go. [Erin puts too much shaving cream on Michael's face, none on the neck]

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Alright. This is how we do it. Feels nice, doesn't it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It really does. This is luxery. Here we go. Ah, that is nice.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You wanted to talk to us Deangelo?

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Ah, yes, please! Just cozy up there. Just thought we could have some rap sessions with smaller groups.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, we don't really do rap sessions. We kinda do... [Erin shaves Michael] god... we sorta do more of like powwows or-

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Ok, then, powwows then, fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey, Deangelo, my mom just sent me this picture of Cece, it is so adorable.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Alright, wait, little bit of backstory, she loves dogs. She calls them 'da-das'.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Da-das.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: And what happens here is-

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: You know what, enough about your baby, ok? I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: We were... I think she was just trying to-

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: No, no, no, I know what you're doing. Just quit it. I want to hear from the rank and file. How can I be the best manager for you all? What can I do better?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You know what, everybody? You have to be honest, here. You can't say that everything is perfect. So, you know, come up with something.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Well, Deangelo, I'd say communication could be improved. People stopped reading memos, so everyone marks them urgent.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok, you know what, I mark it urgent A, urgent B, urgent C, urgent D. Urgent A is the most important, urgent D you don't even really have to worry about.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Michael, can you stop talking now? I need to shave your lips.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Don't shave my lips.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: [Andy walks into room] What's up?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I don't mean to go into a rant here, but...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I wrote the perfect joke. Topical, edgy, funny.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: ...I saw this thing on the news. Democrats want electric cars. Republicans don't. I'm thinking, 'how crazy is it that we have a car debate going on in a city known for gridlock.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Let's not talk politics in the office, ok? I like you better as a funny guy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [leans on table] I wasn't taking a position. It's just one of those things where- [table collapses under Andy]

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: [laughter] Now that's funny! That's funny! You walk much?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah, right, I mean- [walks into door, jokingly]

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Little click...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: [pushing box into office] Deangelo, this box came for you.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Thank you. That's my stuff. Yeah. Michael, take a look at this.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Need a hand?

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Oh, that'd be great, thank you Stanley!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You know, this office sort of has a perfect Feng Shui to it, so... you know, let's not go overboard with the re-decorating, and I'm still here-

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: [holds up painting of desert to office, who are impressed]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I still have to look at this stuff, guys.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: So this is a ten-gallon hat, huh?

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Yep, ten-gallon hat. Technically, it only holds about three quartz. Little factoid.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Interesting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Deangelo's great. I love the guy. But I'm not sure he's a great fit for the office. And also, I'm not sure if I love the guy.

quotes.speaker: Darryl's sister
quotes.line: [holds out cowboy boots for Darryl]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Cool, cool. Alright, see you later.

quotes.speaker: Darryl's sister
quotes.line: Hey, hey, hey! [holds up set of pistols in holsters]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: No, I'm good. Keep them.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Hey, funny man! Whatcha got for me? Make me laugh?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [mimes using a rope to pull himself forward to microwave] Let's see if they have my favorite teas in here... [throws tea packets into air, puts hand in unplugged toaster, pretends to be shocked, takes container of cheese-puffs and throws them into air, pours hot coffee on his pants]

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: [laughs] Drink some soap!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [drinks hand soap]

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: [laughter and applause]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I guess this is my life now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: How do I become a manger at Sabre?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: First thing's first, thank you for coming here directly. I know you could have called Tallahassee but they would've just looped back to me, so, it's cool you recognized my role here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I left a message at corporate.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Ahh. There you go. Get a recommendation from Michael. That'll put you right on the shortlist for next time there's an opening.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Can't you just use the recommendation you already have on file?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: What recommendation?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: From when he recommended me to replace him.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: ...I'm sorry, I never know how to act in these awkward-type situations.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Best whale watching: easily the west coast. If you're going whale watching on the East Coast, you might wanna bring a magazine called "West Coast Whales'. [laughter] Because you're not gonna see them-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [interrupting Deangelo] Snack time! It's the witching hour! It's the sandwitching hour!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Awesome!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Mmm, whatcha got?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: PB and J, my mom's recipe! [throws sandwitch at Phyllis]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Michael! Deangelo has a peanut allergy.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: I need a wide berth. I need a wide berth from those nuts.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: What are you doing? Have you lost your mind?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I think Kevin wants one. Kevin, here you go! [throws sandwitch into Kevin's open mouth]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Michael, this is serious! Do you know what happens if Deangelo touches a peanut?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Michael, the last time I was exposed to a peanut, I was itchy for three days, ok? I had to take baths constantly. I missed the O.J. verdict. I had to read about it in the paper like an idiot.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wait, so, you don't go into shock or die or anything?

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: No, Jim, not everything is life or death. I want to feel comfortable.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oscar, here you go. [throws sandwitch]

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: [uses book to stop the sandwitch's flight] You're getting nut particles all in the air!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No one had a problem with the air here until you came around.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: [steps into conference room] Everyone, mandatory meeting. Multi-purpose room, now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, that's good. You just stay in there, stay in there by yourself, loser. No body go in. [disgusted comments by co-workers] No body go in there. Stay where you are.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Michael, This is insane.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, it's not insane, Oscar. I'm been here for 19 years, and just because someone else is called the boss, you're gonna throw it all away? No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Listen, you're the one who decided to leave. Come on, he's the new boss, you know we have to do this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, who needs him. Guess it's just you and me, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Correction. Just you. Alright, meeting. Multi-function room.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: [walks out] Hold on, Hey Michael, Michael, wait up, hold on. Um, so for these meetings do you just jump into business or do you start with some chit-chat or...?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I start with some chit-chat and a maybe a couple of jokes. And you might want to develop a couple of characters. You know what, you'll be fine.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Maybe. Maybe not. 50/50. You know what, it is too bad for this place that you're leaving. [extents hands for hug] Bring it in, come on. [Michael doesn't accept hug] Ok. [walks back]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok. [hugs Deangelo from behind] Why did you have to be so damn good?

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: I... I'm adequete. I'm half as good as you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, no. Come on. You are good, they know it.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Will you do me a favour and enjoy this time, ok? You've worked so hard, get your senioritis on. It's Lake Havasu time!

quotes.speaker: Micahel
quotes.line: Guess I've been working so hard I forgot what it's like to be hardly working.

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: Ok. What is the Native American girl's name?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You'll figure it out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey, Deangelo! Wanna meet Cece?

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: That's a cute baby. Very cute baby. Adorable. Very cute.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Thank you very much.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: See, we knew it! If he just met her, he'd understand.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: We're back in! Right?

quotes.speaker: Deangelo
quotes.line: I swear, that baby could be the star of a show entitled 'Babys I Don't Care About.'
